intro: Chloraea tectata, commonly known as the mountain devil, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical rainforests of Queensland, Australia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which are clustered in dense, showy inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical and arranged oppositely along the stems. Chloraea tectata plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing nectar for various pollinators.
